importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication marks the culmination of the National League Championship Series, with the Los Angeles Dodgers sweeping the Milwaukee Brewers in four games, leading into the World Series.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline centers on the 2025 postseason, specifically the NLCS and the upcoming World Series, highlighting a significant moment in baseball history due to Shohei Ohtani's historic performance.

keyTakeAways: Shohei Ohtani delivered an unprecedented individual performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, hitting three home runs and striking out 10 batters while pitching six innings in a shutout.
Ohtani became the first starting pitcher since 1900 to hit a leadoff home run in the playoffs and the first since 1900 to hit multiple home runs in a postseason game.
Ohtani is the first player in MLB history to hit three home runs and strike out at least one batter (and 10) in the same game.
The performance occurred after Ohtani pitched in a 13-day span, a grueling schedule for a starting pitcher, demonstrating extraordinary physical endurance.
The Los Angeles Dodgers swept the Milwaukee Brewers in four games, securing their 26th World Series appearance and fifth consecutive NL pennant in the past nine seasons.
Ohtani was named National League Championship Series Most Valuable Player (MVP), with teammates praising his performance as legendary and potentially historic.
The Dodgers have lost only one game in the postseason, and their pitching has allowed no more than one run per game since a prior loss.

With the Seattle Mariners leading the ALCS 3–2, the Dodgers will face the AL champion in the World Series, facing a formidable playoff rotation including Ohtani, Blake Snell, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, and Tyler Glasnow.

This marks the first time a team has returned to the World Series the year after winning it since the Philadelphia Phillies in the late 2000s, and the first repeat champion since the Yankees' 1998–2000 run.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Japanese professional baseball player and two-way star (pitcher and hitter)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani is the central figure whose legendary performance in the NLCS led to the Dodgers' sweep and earned him NLCS MVP status, marking a historic milestone in MLB history due to his unique dual role and performance on both offense and defense.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the team that achieved a four-game sweep over the Milwaukee Brewers and advanced to the World Series, with Ohtani's performance being a defining moment in their postseason run.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were the opponents in the NLCS, which the Dodgers swept, marking the end of the playoff series and the start of the World Series matchup.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are in the ALCS against the Toronto Blue Jays, and their 3–2 lead creates a scenario where the Dodgers will face them in the World Series, making them a critical opponent in the next phase of the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the opposing team in the ALCS against the Seattle Mariners, and their eventual champion status will determine the Dodgers' World Series opponent.

namedEntities.name: Clayton Kershaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former MLB pitcher and current Dodger team member
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kershaw praised Ohtani’s performance and is seen as a key figure in the Dodgers’ success, reflecting on the team’s chemistry and legacy as they prepare for the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: MLB first baseman and member of the Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman expressed awe at Ohtani’s performance, emphasizing the team effort and the historic nature of Ohtani’s game, highlighting the broader team dynamics.

namedEntities.name: Dave Roberts
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Roberts described the team’s success as a turning point, stating that the Dodgers are ‘ruining baseball’ and making history as the first team to return to the World Series after winning it in the prior year.

namedEntities.name: Sarah Langs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Langs confirmed Ohtani’s historic statistical milestones, including being the first to hit three home runs and strike out 10 batters in a single game.

namedEntities.name: TNT Sports
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: TNT Sports provided commentary and coverage of Ohtani’s performance, confirming records and highlighting the historic nature of the game.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Shohei Ohtani delivered a legendary performance in Game 4 of the National League Championship Series, leading the Los Angeles Dodgers to a four-game sweep of the Milwaukee Brewers. Ohtani hit three home runs—including a leadoff blast and two in the same game—struck out 10 batters, and pitched six innings in a shutout, becoming the first starting pitcher since 1900 to hit multiple home runs in a postseason game and the first to do so in the playoffs. He also became the first player in MLB history to hit three home runs and strike out at least one (10) in the same game. The performance, achieved after pitching in just 13 days, earned him NLCS MVP honors and solidified his place in baseball history. The Dodgers, now the first team to return to the World Series the year after winning it since the Phillies in the late 2000s, will face the American League champion—either the Seattle Mariners or Toronto Blue Jays—in the World Series, where they are expected to face a formidable lineup including Ohtani, Blake Snell, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, and Tyler Glasnow. The event has been widely celebrated as 'the Shohei Ohtani Game,' with teammates and analysts calling it one of the most extraordinary individual performances in MLB history.
title: Shohei Ohtani’s Legendary Night Leads Los Angeles Dodgers to Another World Series, Sweeping Milwaukee in 4 Games
